completelyFalse.description: Score 1: Completely False (hallucinations or contradicts context)

mixed.description: Score 3: Mixed (some supported facts, some hallucinations)

examples.question: อยากพัฒนาตัวเองให้ทำงานสายเทคโนโลยีได้
examples.judgeReasoning: Mostly based on the provided course contexts and correctly links many courses to the stated skills (e.g., programming courses → algorithm design; DB courses → relational design and SQL; ML courses → supervised/unsupervised methods). However, the answer includes several unsupported negative/qualifying claims not present in the context — e.g., statements that specific courses “do not cover” advanced software development, web/app integration, advanced network coding/security, large-model training or deployment, or that no course prepares for a complete end-to-end tech job. Those are interpretive assertions beyond the explicit learning outcomes and thus reduce faithfulness.

fail.description: Score 1: Fail (just lists codes, or says none found when valid options exist)

weak.description: Score 2: Weak (very little context or explanation)

descriptiveOnly.description: Score 3: Descriptive Only (lists facts, doesn't explain value to user)

insights.systemStrength: High overall pass rate; No complete hallucinations; No major factual errors; All answers provide some explanation; Good explanatory bridging
insights.systemWeakness: Frequently mixes supported facts with hallucinations
insights.recommendation: Reduce partial hallucinations by requiring all claims to be context-supported.
